title: Watch: Las Vegas man discovers the hard way when you throw a flying knee at a cop, look out for his friends
description:
What happens in Las Vegas stays in Las Vegas. Unless you attack a cop with a flying knee, then get your ass beat by his friends on Freemont Street. During those very specific instances, what happens in Las Vegas becomes content. Sweet, glorious, content.

We haven't had this much fun in Vegas since the stripper nuns were wildin' out on the street. The guy at the bottom of the cop pile didn't have fun. But we're having fun watching.

What happens in Vegas becomes content if you're this stupid. pic.twitter.com/V7rAvO9V4E
— Louder with Crowder Dot Com (@LWCnewswire) June 5, 2023

It is unclear what led to the incident. Other than alcohol was most likely involved because... Vegas. Unfortunately for our friend, he hit the strip wearing his bad-idea jeans. He's also been watching way too many Jorge Masvidal fights and thought it was easy to knock someone out with a flying knee.

Here's some life advice. If you are going to attack a cop on a crowded public street with a flying knee, run. Don't stand around. Our dude seemed legit surprised there was a second cop on the street of Las Vegas in the evening.

Then a third. Then a fourth. Then some security guards, who are always looking for an excuse. Tying the incident together was the man with the iPhone who was enjoying weed being legal and remembered to do it for the content.

At the bottom of the pile is the instigator, wondering why everyone is so upset.

The streets of Las Vegas are once again safe from random flying knee attacks. Thank you to Las Vegas's finest for their service. Thank you to the guy who started it for the laughs.

>

<

Brodigan is Grand Poobah of this here website and when he isn't writing words about things enjoys day drinking, pro-wrestling, and country music. You can find him on the Twitter too.

title: Liberal woman goes viral throwing liberal men under the bus because she can't find one to date who acts like a man
description:
Matt Walsh needs to launch a sequel to his documentary called "What is a man?," because this liberal woman is struggling. Tired of liberal men who try to get into her pants by literally trying to get into her pants just to see how they fit, she wants to know if it's possible to find a man who a) acts like a man, b) treats her like a woman, and c) is not a conservative.

Give her credit. She is tired of dating soy and is reaching out to the one person who might be able to help. The Internet.

Liberal Woman complains about dating lib men bc they're not men... continues dating them

Which one of you wants to save her? pic.twitter.com/gVJVHM2gVF
— 🌴 Josh Lekach 🌴 (@JoshLekach) June 3, 2023
It is really hard to find a man who wants to pay on the first date, who wants to open your door, who has that want and desire to take care of you and to provide who is not a conservative.

I'm admittedly out of practice, but is paying for the first date NOT something men are expected to do and/or stopped doing? Because there's an Extra Gum commercial that drives me insane. This twerp is having an existential crisis when asked by a waiter "together or separate" because he doesn't know if he should pay for the date or not. Every time it is on I want to reach through the TV, shove his head in a toilet, and steal his girl.

But yes. If having a man who is a gentleman and chivalrous is something you desire and are only finding in conservative men, it's because most liberal men are pussies. If you want someone to get your door for you, you might also need to be okay with your date voting for Ron DeSantis.

And obviously, as a liberal woman, I do wanna be respected for my independence and I do want to have my own autonomy in the relationship and not be combined or conform to the traditional female homemaker childbearing role... I don't want to compromise my morals and values.

I think I see the problem here. Outside of the few conservative men she accidentally swiped right on, she doesn't know any IRL conservative men OR conservative women. Conservative women have autonomy and independence. Conservative men enjoy cooking. Allow me to blow our friend here's mind. 98% of what she has heard about conservative men and conservative women from TikTok and leftist tabloids like CNN? Complete bullshit.

Speaking as a conservative man who has dated liberal women before, I'll give her some advice. Just don't talk about politics. And if you do, either be respectful or after you get into a fight about the election, enjoy the make-up sex and go see a movie.

>

<

Brodigan is Grand Poobah of this here website and when he isn't writing words about things enjoys day drinking, pro-wrestling, and country music. You can find him on the Twitter too.

title: Watch: US women's soccer team gets WRECKED by an older male team of retirees
description:
On Friday, a women’s soccer team that included members of the CURRENT U.S. National team in a 32-team tournament for a $1M prize. The Women’s Team lost 12-0 to Wrexham, a team of retirees who last played in the early 2000s.

You see how easy it really is in how little the guys celebrate. There’s no real joy in defeating a vastly inferior opponent in any sport. https://t.co/kYSsYoyuQ5
— Gerald A (@GmorganJr) June 5, 2023

The girls were very chatty prior to the throttling. Heather O'Reilly called out Wrexham's celebrity owners Ryan Reynolds and Rob McElhenney. Ironic, because the girls getting crushed by older, retired men sounds like something they would do on It's Always Sunny in Philadelphia.

“This message is for Ryan Reynolds (@VancityReynolds) & @RMcElhenney!”@HeatherOReilly had some words for the @Wrexham_AFC owners. 👀 pic.twitter.com/SUdR3YqI8d
— TST (@TST7v7) June 2, 2023

A 12-0 shutout later, the girls weren't as trash talky. Afterward, O'Reilly says the result didn't matter because, quote, "We don't care because we're living, we're being bold, we're being brave."

Gerald (filling in for Crowder) and the gang had a lot of fun at the team's expense on today's show:

title: WATCH TODAY'S SHOW: ELON MUSK IN TURMOIL? WHAT IS A WOMAN" DOC CAUSES TWITTER BOYCOTT!
description:
In this episode, Gerald A & Lane discuss the "What is a Woman" Twitter fiasco. Was it a coincidence that the Head of Twitter's Trust & Safety, Ella Irwin quit?! We have the latest. Also, is Elon in bed with China? We'll also be talking about Biden falling on stage & Nikki Haley's CNN Town Hall.

NIKKI HALEY TOWN HALL

  • Qunnipiac Poll
  • Nikki Haley answers Iowa voters' questions at CNN town hall

US WOMEN WRECKED

  • The Soccer Tournament EXTENDED HIGHLIGHTS: US Women vs. Wrexham

BIDEN FUMBLES

  • Biden falls at Air Force Academy graduation ceremony
  • Biden falls at Air Force Academy graduation ceremony
  • Biden signs bipartisan debt ceiling bill to avert government default
  • Watch Biden’s full Oval Office address about the debt ceiling deal
  • Fact check: Biden’s latest false statistical claims
  • Biden Says MAGA Republicans Are Danger to Country
  • CBS News's Margaret Brennan

TWITTER: WHAT HAPPENED

  • Daily Wire CEO Jeremy Boering reported that the film was canceled due to misgendering
  • Twitter CEO Elon Musk said limiting the movie was a mistake
  • Ella Irwin, who was head of Twitter Trust and Safety resigned
  • Twitter loses its SECOND safety exec within two days: Head of brand safety and ad quality leaves Elon Musk's company - a day after platform's Head of Trust’s shock resignation
  • Musk recommends the movie
  • Elon Musk praises his employees in China enthusiastic
  • Qin Gang Meets with Chief Executive Officer of Tesla Elon Musk
  • Beijing Says Musk Opposes Decoupling of U.S., China
  • China was top market for Tesla Model Y, world's best-selling car in Q1
  • Elon Musk: Tesla to build new battery factory in Shanghai
  • Elon Musk: Tesla criticised after opening Xinjiang showroom

title: NBA star launches new conservative, anti-woke urban clothing line: "We don't have to hide"
description:
Conservatives, Christians, and other Normie-Americans want anti-woke alternatives to the companies that make it abundantly clear how much they hate us. Orlando Magic star Jonathan Isaac is the latest to attempt to do so. He's launched a new clothing line called Unitus. To, unlike woke companies, "unite us" (get it) instead of dividing us along the left's extreme partisan lines.

He announced the brand during the new Prager U documentary "Unwoke, Inc."

\u201cRetail brands have the freedom to go woke. We have the freedom to create an alternative. UNITUS launches August 2023. Stay tuned\ud83d\ude43 #WeAreUnitus\u201d
— Jonathan Isaac (@Jonathan Isaac) 1685665866


Who is Jonathan Isaac?


Jonathan Isaac is a forward for the Orlando Magic and was their #1 draft pick in 2017. He started to crossover into the political world during the 2020 summer of riots. When the rest of his team kneeled in solidarity with the Marxist political organization Black Lives Matter, Inc. during the National Anthem, he stood for America.

Isaac also stood for medical freedom in 2021, by opposing the schmaccine mandates. He was attacked for it in Rolling Stone. Besides rejecting mandates on the grounds of freedom, the anti-science regulations the NBA thrust on players didn't make a lick of sense either. He said in an interview:

"I don't know all of the regulations that have been laid out. ... I'm not allowed to go to like team functions. Or if the team is eating in a restaurant, I can't eat in the same room as them. To me, it just doesn't logically follow for us then to get on the court together. ...All of this is coming about talking about a virus was such a high survival rate."

"Retail brands have the freedom to go woke. We have the freedom to create an alternative."


Isaac says, "You have companies that are in that field who have made a conscious decision to either attack or undermine Christian values, conservative values, and things like that. And I think they have the free choice to do so, as much as I disagree, but I feel that we also have the freedom to create what we want to create."

The plan is to sign athletes from all sports. He wants to provide alternatives for young sports fans and their parents so that they know if they are spending their hard-earned money on something it isn't going to a company that hates them.

"The hope is to create a real infrastructure of people who are in the sports world [for] moms and dads who want to buy their kids sneakers and clothes but want to give their money to a company that they know is going to bloster their values."

This shows promise. Let's be honest. Any time there is a "Christian" or "Conservative" alternative brand, it tends to be another c-word. Corny. Isaac being a professional athlete lends authenticity to make Unitus a "legit" brand as opposed to just a Christan and/or conservative one. I'm optimistic about this.

>

<

Brodigan is Grand Poobah of this here website and when he isn't writing words about things enjoys day drinking, pro-wrestling, and country music. You can find him on the Twitter too.

title: "Influencer ad agency" responsible for Dylan Mulvaney/Bud Light fiasco is in series panic mode too
description:
As it turns out, making Dylan Mulvaney a brand ambassador for Bud Light was NOT the brainchild of disgraced former Vice President of Marketing Alissa Heinersceid. Capitv8 (like "captivate" only with the number "8" because... reasons) are the ones who paired the titface performer and TikTok ingénue with the beer company. And not unlike the beer company, Capitiv8 is in a panic too.

Apparently being responsible for a colossal marketing blunder that destroys a brand's reputation and costs a company b-b-b-billions of dollars is not a not look for a marketing company.


Shocker, the company is based in San Francisco


When Anheuser-Busch claimed this was all the fault of an independent ad agency, they were talking about the San Francisco-based Capitiv8. Sources tell the New York Post the firm -- which boasts a database of more than 1 million influencers on YouTube, TikTok, etc. -- has been sent into "serious panic mode" over the 26 billion dollars mistake that's turned into a textbook case of marketing gone wrong.

“There was a lot of chatter” among employees about what blowback the firm might face over the botched campaign, according to the source.

“Internally, the company was in serious panic mode,” the source added.

Capitv8 did not respond to the Post's request for comment.

So how exactly did this work?


The Post could not confirm if it was Captiv8's idea to put Mulvaney's face on the can to celebrate 365 days of "girlhood." Nor could they confirm if the influencer ad agency had a hand in producing Mulvaney's content that insulted Bud Light's customer base.

This isn’t a parody. Dylan Mulvaney is now the face of Bud Light. pic.twitter.com/cpygA74cG5
— Ian Miles Cheong (@stillgray) April 2, 2023

We need a "Twitter-Files" -esque investigation into how this came about. I'm picturing a conversation between Bud Light VP Melissa Weinerchild and Krishna Subramanian, founder of Captiv8.

WEINERCHILD: Too many fratty and out-of-touch cis white men enjoy Bud Light. I'm looking for a campaign that will market Bud Light to people who don't drink Bud Light.

SUBMARINER: Have I got an act for you! We've got this guy, or this girl. It gets confusing.

WEINERCHILD: OMG, I know, right?

SUBMARINER: Anyway this -- them -- is so got right now on TikTok. Dylan Mulvaney. S/he records videos acting out a vapid stereotype about women.

WEINERCHILD: That...sounds kinda offensive.

SUBMARINER: See, that's the thing. Because she's trans and they say they are celebrating Day X, it's not offensive at all. It's tolerance and equity.

WEINERCHILD: I know those words!

SUBMARINER: One video with Dylan and you won't have to worry about your ESG score for an entire fiscal year.

WEINERCHILD: Done! Send he/she/they/it doesn't matter a case of Bud Light. I have a podcast to do.

No one is sure what will become of Captiv8 after this. Maybe they can make a comeback by signing that Mizzy character as the new spokesman for Target's new Department of Social Justice. It's a woke company. There's nowhere else to fail but up!

>

<

Brodigan is Grand Poobah of this here website and when he isn't writing words about things enjoys day drinking, pro-wrestling, and country music. You can find him on the Twitter too.

title: Credit where it's due: Nikki Haley answers CNN's abortion question the way conservatives have been waiting for
description:
There was a time years ago when I would have considered Nikki Haley for president. Chris Christie too... in 2013. There was a lot of SLAY KWEEN'ING over Haley in 2017 when she was Donald Trump's Ambassador to the UN. Then she threw Trump under the bus after January 6th when she thought that's what people were doing. Then when she realized that wasn't what people were doing tried to flip back. Now she is an example of the old GOP guard that we don't need anymore.

HOWEVER, conservatives have been waiting for someone to answer the abortion question like this for some time. Haley was asked to pinpoint on what week her abortion restrictions would begin.

So what did she say?


I will answer that when you ask Kamala and Biden if they would agree to 37 weeks, 38 weeks, 39 weeks, then I’ll answer your question. No one asks them that. No one asks them how late they’re willing to go.

Please note that "Rupar" is a verb meaning to "purposely mislead, To intentionally and grossly mischaracterize a statement and/or video." Hence Rupar letting the point sail over his head and claiming this video is about Nikki "refusing" to answer an abortion ban question. Her "not" answering was the answer.

Missing from this clip is Jake Tapper being all like "I think Biden and Harris have been clear that they don’t support any restrictions" and Nikki clapping back all like "They said abortion up to the time of birth, right?"

Did they really though?


Neither Biden nor Kamala said that because neither Biden nor Kamala -- or any Democrat -- are asked to get that specific. Republicans are deemed "extreme" for saying that maaaaaaybe somewhere between six and twelve weeks is enough time to decide if you're going to abort your choice.

What is the SPECIFIC Democrat position on the other end? 37 weeks? 40 weeks? Just before the birthing person starts crowning? Do they support Cartman's mom wanting to abort her child in the fortieth trimester? Remember, Democrats are also the party of government-assisted suicide. If you think that is too far of a stretch, you probably think there would never be a time where Democrats said men could have babies.

Nikki Haley is spot on about Democrats needing to be held to SPECIFICS when it comes to their pro-abortion agenda. Hopefully, either Ron DeSantis or Donald Trump remembers to put Joe Biden on the spot during the presidential debates.

>

<

Brodigan is Grand Poobah of this here website and when he isn't writing words about things enjoys day drinking, pro-wrestling, and country music. You can find him on the Twitter too.
